equipment.description: Dynamic pump using a rotating impeller to increase fluid pressure via centrifugal force, conforming to API 610.
Positive displacement pump using a piston or plunger for high-pressure applications.
Dynamic compressor using rotating impellers for continuous gas compression, typical for pipeline or process gas.
Positive displacement compressor using pistons for high compression ratios, often used for hydrogen or makeup gas.
Rotary positive displacement compressor using helical screws, common for instrument air or refrigeration.
High-flow dynamic compressor with multiple stages of rotating and stationary blades, used in LNG trains.
Internal combustion engine using a continuous combustion process to drive generators or mechanical equipment.
Turbine extracting thermal energy from pressurized steam to perform mechanical work.
Electromechanical device converting electrical energy into mechanical energy, typically an AC induction motor.
Air-cooled heat exchanger using fans to force air over finned tubes for process cooling.
Machine for moving air or gas with a moderate pressure increase.
Device consisting of a rotating shaft and impeller for mixing liquids or slurries in a vessel.
Equipment using centrifugal force to separate fluids of different densities or solids from liquids.
Mechanical handling equipment for transporting bulk solid materials like coke or sulfur.
Radial inflow turbine used to cool gas streams and recover power, essential in cryogenic gas processing.
Closed container designed to hold gases or liquids at a pressure substantially different from ambient.
Large container for holding liquids, typically atmospheric, conforming to API 650.
Storage tank with a roof that floats on the liquid surface to minimize evaporative emissions.
Spherical pressure vessel for storing high-pressure fluids like LPG or ammonia.
Horizontal cylindrical pressure vessel with hemispherical heads for pressurized storage.
Vessel designed to contain chemical reactions, often with catalyst beds and internal distributors.
Vessel in a Fluid Catalytic Cracking unit where coke is burned off the catalyst to restore activity.
Large vertical vessel used in the delayed coking process for thermal cracking of heavy residues.
Vessel used to separate well fluids into gas and liquid phases (two-phase) or oil, gas, and water (three-phase).
Vertical vessel containing trays or packing for separating liquid mixtures based on boiling points.
Column used to remove light components from a liquid stream using a stripping vapor.
Column where gas components are absorbed into a liquid solvent, common in amine treating.
Vessel designed to remove particulates or liquid droplets from a gas stream.
Vessel using an electrostatic field to coalesce and remove brine and salts from crude oil.
Pressurized barrel used to insert a pipeline pig into a pipeline for cleaning or inspection.
Pressurized barrel used to retrieve a pipeline pig at the end of a pipeline segment.
Heat exchanger consisting of a shell with a bundle of tubes inside, the most common type in process industries.
Heat exchanger using metal plates to transfer heat between two fluids, offering high efficiency in a compact size.
Shell and tube heat exchanger used to vaporize the bottom product of a distillation column.
Direct-fired furnace used to heat process fluids to high temperatures, such as crude feed or reformer feed.
Boiler that generates steam by recovering heat from hot process gas streams.
Heat exchanger specifically designed to condense a vapor stream into a liquid.
Multi-turn linear motion valve used primarily for on/off service with low pressure drop.
Linear motion valve used for stopping, starting, and regulating flow.
Quarter-turn valve using a spherical closure element for quick shutoff.
Quarter-turn valve with a disk closure, suitable for large diameter lines and low pressure drop.
Valve that allows fluid to flow in only one direction, preventing backflow.
Spring-loaded valve designed to automatically relieve excess pressure to prevent equipment failure.
Power-operated valve used to regulate fluid flow, pressure, or temperature in response to a controller signal.
Specialized valve used on wellheads to control the flow rate of fluids produced from a well.
Mass flow meter that measures density and flow rate directly using the Coriolis effect.
Non-intrusive flow meter using ultrasonic waves to measure fluid velocity.
Sensor that measures pressure and converts it into an electrical signal for control systems.
Sensor assembly used to measure temperature and transmit the data to a control system.
Non-contact level measurement device using radar pulses to determine liquid level in a tank.
Instrument for continuous online analysis of gas stream composition (e.g., Gas Chromatograph).
Combination of electrical disconnect switches, fuses, or circuit breakers to control and protect electrical equipment.
Static electrical device that transfers energy between circuits while changing voltage levels.
Electronic controller that adjusts the speed of an AC motor by varying the frequency and voltage supplied.
Electrical apparatus that provides emergency power to a load when the input power source fails.
Combination of a diesel engine and an electric generator to produce electrical energy.
Elevated vertical stack used for burning off unusable waste gas or flammable gas released by pressure relief valves.
Device with a mesh screen used to mechanically remove solid debris from a flowing fluid.
Automatic valve that filters out condensate and non-condensable gases while preventing the escape of live steam.
Safety device that stops fuel combustion by extinguishing the flame front.
